to access the map and building guide.

https://durhamuniversity.sharepoint.com/teams/ChemistryPostgraduates/SitePages/Map-and-Room-Information.aspx
Helpful information once you find the Chemistry building:

Reception is on the First floor and is best reached by entering through the red
glass atrium (you may hear it referred to as The Red Greenhouse!) Turn right and
walk straight along the corridor, and it's Room CG160 on the right. NB there is
more than 1 entrance to the building and they are on different floors!
The University has a brand new app ‘Durham University Tours’ that is available to
to take a range of self-guided tours around the city.

- 'General Audio Tour’ showing all of the main University and Department
buildings
- 'Colleges Audio Tour’ showing you the 17 Colleges

- 'Essential Practicalities Audio Tour’ highlighting the essential practicalities you
might need when living in Durham. This includes healthcare, food, travel and
where to buy day-to-day essential items.

Tours have audio descriptions, images and videos as well as lots of information
and statistics. The 'General Audio Tour’ and ‘College Audio Tour’ also include
walking route videos showing the way that you would walk between stops.

Additionally, within the app there is a list of ‘Places to Eat and Drink' where the
University has compiled 37 of their favourite cafés, restaurants and bars in one
place. So if you're undertaking a self-guided tour in Durham, be sure to check this
out.

Don't forget to complete the survey at the end of your tour or by clicking on the
‘Audio Tours Survey’ link in the menu items. The University is always working to
make sure that what we offer is of the highest standard and love to hear your
feedback!
https://durhamuniversity.sharepoint.com/teams/ChemistryPostgraduates/SitePages/Map-and-Room-Information.aspx 2/6
